channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why Bangladesh unrest is a big worry for India
Bill Clinton in a pool, little on Trump: What the latest release of Epstein files reveals
This Week in Explainers: How Trump’s H-1B crackdown has put Indians in a limbo
History Today: How Zulfikar Ali Bhutto took charge of Pakistan after losing 1971 war
Why Europe went for a loan to help Ukraine instead of frozen Russian assets
Who owns TikTok now? The deal explained
How Inqilab Moncho’s Chittagong protest turned Osman Hadi’s death into an anti-India street weapon
item.description: What should have remained a domestic demand for justice was deliberately converted into a strategic provocation, redirecting public anger toward a foreign state without evidence and testing the limits of international diplomatic norms

item.title: How the idea of ‘Core Five’ is a mirage in present-day geopolitics
item.description: The idea of Core Five—the US, China, Russia, India, and Japan—reflects a recurring temptation in periods of global flux: the belief that smaller clubs can substitute for inclusive governance

item.title: Before pursuing South Asia, Pakistan must fix itself: Regional cooperation is impossible without India
item.description: Pakistan’s immediate and overwhelming challenge lies not in designing new regional architectures, but in confronting its own internal political fragmentation, restoring civilian credibility, and learning the basic grammar of cooperation within its own borders before attempting to prescribe it to the region

item.title: How PM Modi’s West Asia-Africa visit means big for Global South
item.description: For the global order, India’s manoeuvres underscore a persistent truth. The 21st-century diplomacy will be neither unipolar nor bipolar but matrixed

item.title: Bangladesh at a crossroads: Between street unrest and a soft state
item.description: Pragmatism, not ideological escalation, is what enabled Bangladesh’s economic and diplomatic gains over the past decade. Abandoning that path in favour of emotive nationalism risks isolating the country regionally and undermining investor confidence domestically

item.title: How PM Modi’s Ethiopia visit revitalised India’s Africa outreach and Global South cooperation
item.description: For India, the partnership with Ethiopia provides a trusted anchor in the Horn of Africa, a region marked by instability but also strategic opportunity
